metadata.title: CVE-2022-23133 on Ubuntu 24.10 (oracular) - medium
metadata.description:
An authenticated user can create a hosts group from the configuration withXSS payload, which will be available for other users. When XSS is stored byan authenticated malicious actor and other users try to search for groupsduring new host creation, the XSS payload will fire and the actor can stealsession cookies and perform session hijacking to impersonate users or takeover their accounts.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-23133` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

zabbix-agent - 1:6.0.29+dfsg-1
zabbix-agent2 - 1:6.0.29+dfsg-1
zabbix-frontend-php - 1:6.0.29+dfsg-1
zabbix-java-gateway - 1:6.0.29+dfsg-1
zabbix-proxy-mysql - 1:6.0.29+dfsg-1
zabbix-proxy-pgsql - 1:6.0.29+dfsg-1
zabbix-proxy-sqlite3 - 1:6.0.29+dfsg-1
zabbix-server-mysql - 1:6.0.29+dfsg-1
zabbix-server-pgsql - 1:6.0.29+dfsg-1
zabbix-web-service - 1:6.0.29+dfsg-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: zabbix package in oracular, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:6.0.29+dfsg-1').
